#summary Community
#sidebar TableOfContentsSDL


= Mailing List =

Send support questions to the [http://groups.google.com/group/lispbuilder LISPBUILDER mailing list].

= Wiki =

You are [http://code.google.com/p/lispbuilder/wiki/LispbuilderSDL reading it]. Note that wiki is only editable for logged in project members. 

= Chat =

From time to time, project members are availabe on the IRC-channel, #lisp. 

= Bugs and Features =

Use the [http://code.google.com/p/lispbuilder/issues/list issue tracking system] to report bugs and request features.

= Projects using LISPBUILDER-SDL =

 * [http://lispgamesdev.blogspot.com Lisp Games Blog]
 * [http://dto.github.com/notebook/blast.html Blast Tactics]
 * [http://lispgamesdev.blogspot.com/2009/07/preview-of-bratwurst.html Remake of the Amiga game Bratwurst]
 * Uxul-world, [http://wiki.github.com/dasuxullebt/uxul-world], and [http://uxul.wordpress.com/2009/04/07/a-detailed-preview-of-my-jnr-game-written-in-common-lisp/ JNR].
 * [http://github.com/sykopomp Common-Worm, and yashmup], [http://sykosomatic.org/lisp/level1.ogv Video of yashmup]
 * [http://sourceforge.net/projects/latrunculi/ Latrunculi]
 * [http://code.google.com/p/lisp-game-engine/ Lisp-Game-Engine]
 * [http://dto.github.com/notebook/rlx.html RLX: a cross-platform graphical roguelike engine]
  * RLX has been superseded by [http://dto.github.com/notebook/xe2-reference.html XE2], a game engine which is now capable of other genres of 2D games.
 * [http://purevirtual.com/~anthony/jigsaw-puzzle/index.html Jigsaw Puzzle Game], and [http://anthonyf.wordpress.com/2006/12/27/a-lispy-jigsaw-puzzle-game/]
 * [http://code.google.com/p/blackthorn-engine/ Blackthorn], a 2D game engine based on an object tree like Lisp-Game-Engine. So far, two games have been built with Blackthorn (downloads available from the main project page):
  * Bunny Slayer, a top-down RPG in the style of Zelda.
  * Thopter, a scrolling shooter game with multiplayer co-op support. ([http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5MDqC6XG-Ag Video])
 * [http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2007/12/16/working-title-ruckus/ Ruckus: Entry into the Ludumdare '07 compo]
